Package org.ejbca.core.ejb.hardtoken

Interface HardTokenBatchJobSession

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HardTokenBatchJobSessionLocal, HardTokenBatchJobSessionRemote
    public interface HardTokenBatchJobSession
    Version:
    $Id: HardTokenBatchJobSession.java 19902 2014-09-30 14:32:24Z anatom $

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      boolean checkForHardTokenIssuerId​(int hardtokenissuerid)
      Methods that checks if a user exists in the database having the given hard token issuer id.
      Collection<EndEntityInformation> getNextHardTokensToGenerate​(String alias)
      Returns a Collection of users scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.
      EndEntityInformation getNextHardTokenToGenerate​(String alias)
      Returns the next user scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.
      EndEntityInformation getNextHardTokenToGenerateInQueue​(String alias, int index)
      Returns the indexed user in queue scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.
      int getNumberOfHardTokensToGenerate​(String alias)
      Returns the number of users scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.

    • Method Detail

      • getNextHardTokenToGenerate

        EndEntityInformation getNextHardTokenToGenerate​(String alias)
                                         throws UnavailableTokenException
        Returns the next user scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.
        Parameters:
        alias - alias
        Returns:
        The next user to generate or NULL if there are no users i queue.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTokenException - fail

      • getNextHardTokensToGenerate

        Collection<EndEntityInformation> getNextHardTokensToGenerate​(String alias)
                                                      throws UnavailableTokenException
        Returns a Collection of users scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer. A maximum of MAX_RETURNED_QUEUE_SIZE users will be returned by call.
        Parameters:
        alias - alias
        Returns:
        A Collection of users to generate or NULL if there are no users i queue.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTokenException - fail
        javax.ejb.EJBException - if a communication or other error occurs.

      • getNextHardTokenToGenerateInQueue

        EndEntityInformation getNextHardTokenToGenerateInQueue​(String alias,
                                                       int index)
                                                throws UnavailableTokenException
        Returns the indexed user in queue scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.
        Parameters:
        alias - alias
        index - index in queue of user to retrieve. (First position is 1 according to old JDBC implementation.)
        Returns:
        The next token to generate or NULL if the given user doesn't exist in queue.
        Throws:
        UnavailableTokenException - fail
        javax.ejb.EJBException - if a communication or other error occurs.

      • getNumberOfHardTokensToGenerate

        int getNumberOfHardTokensToGenerate​(String alias)
        Returns the number of users scheduled for batch generation for the given issuer.
        Parameters:
        alias - fail
        Returns:
        the number of users to generate.
        Throws:
        javax.ejb.EJBException - if a communication or other error occurs.

      • checkForHardTokenIssuerId

        boolean checkForHardTokenIssuerId​(int hardtokenissuerid)
        Methods that checks if a user exists in the database having the given hard token issuer id. This function is mainly for avoiding desynchronisation when a hard token issuer is deleted.
        Parameters:
        hardtokenissuerid - the id of hard token issuer to look for.
        Returns:
        true if hardtokenissuerid exists in user database.
